1.verse: The Word of Life - That which was from the beginning, which we have heard, which we have seen with our eyes, which we have gazed at, and our hands have handled – concerning the Word of Life!

2.verse: That life was displayed, and we have seen it, and bear witness, and we announce to you the life of God’s coming age, which was with the father and was displayed to us.

3.verse: That which we have seen and heard, we announce to you too, so that you also may have fellowship with us. And our fellowship is with the father, and with his son Jesus the Messiah.

4.verse: We are writing these things so that our joy may be complete.

5.verse: God’s Light and Our Darkness - This is the message which we have heard from him, and announce to you: God is light, and there is no darkness at all in him.

6.verse: If we say that we have fellowship with him and walk in the dark, we are telling lies, and not doing what is true.

7.verse: But if we walk in the light, just as he is in the light, we have fellowship with one another, and the blood of Jesus his son makes us pure and clean from all sin.

8.verse: If we say that we have no sin, we deceive ourselves and the truth is not in us.

9.verse: If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just, and will forgive us our sins, and cleanse us from all unrighteousness.

10.verse: If we say that we have not sinned, we make him out to be a liar, and his word is not in us.

1.verse: My children, I am writing these things to you so that you may not sin. If anyone does sin, we have one who pleads our cause before the father – namely, the Righteous One, Jesus the Messiah!

2.verse: He is the sacrifice which atones for our sins – and not ours only, either, but those of the whole world.

3.verse: God’s New Commandment - This is how we are sure that we have known him, if we keep his commandments.

4.verse: Anyone who says, ‘I know him’, but doesn’t keep his commandments, is a liar. People like that have no truth in them.

5.verse: But if anyone keeps his word, God’s love is truly made complete in such a person. This is how we are sure that we are in him:

6.verse: anyone who says, ‘I abide in him’, ought to behave in the same way that he behaved.

7.verse: My beloved ones, I am not writing a new command to you, but an old command which you have had from the very beginning. The old command is the word which you heard.

8.verse: Again, however, I am writing a new command to you: it is true in him and in you, because the darkness is passing away and the true light is already shining.

9.verse: Anyone who says, ‘I am in the light’, while hating another family member, is still in darkness up to this very moment.

10.verse: Anyone who loves another family member abides in the light, and there is no cause of offence in such a person.

11.verse: Anyone who hates another family member is in the darkness, and walks about in the darkness. Such people have no idea where they are going, because the darkness has blinded their eyes.

12.verse: I am writing to you, children, because your sins are forgiven through his name.

13.verse: I am writing to you, fathers, because you have known the one who is from the beginning. I am writing to you, young people, because you have conquered the evil one.

14.verse: I have written to you, children, because you have known the father. I have written to you, fathers, because you have known the one who is from the beginning. I have written to you, young people, because you are strong, and the word of God abides in you, and you have conquered the evil one.

15.verse: People of the Lie - Do not love the world, or the things that are in the world. If anyone loves the world, the father’s love is not in them.

16.verse: Everything in the world, you see – the greedy desire of the flesh, the greedy desire of the eyes, the pride of life – none of this is from the father. It is from the world.

17.verse: The world is passing away, with all its greedy desires. But anyone who does God’s will abides for ever.

18.verse: Children, it is the last hour. You have heard that ‘Antimessiah’ is coming – and now many Antimessiahs have appeared! That’s how we know that it is the last hour.

19.verse: They went out from among us, but they were not really of our number. If they had been of our number, you see, they would have remained with us. This happened so that it would be made crystal clear that none of them belonged to us.

20.verse: You, however, have the anointing from the Holy One, and you all have knowledge.

21.verse: I am not writing to you because you don’t know the truth, but because you do know it, and you know that no liar is of the truth.

22.verse: Who is the liar? Is it not the one who denies that Jesus is the Messiah? Such a one is the Antimessiah – who denies the father and the son.

23.verse: Nobody who denies the son has the father. One who acknowledges the son has the father too.

24.verse: As for you: let what you heard from the beginning abide in you. If what you heard from the beginning abides in you, you too will abide in the son and in the father.

25.verse: And this is the promise which he himself promised us: the life of the age to come.

26.verse: I am writing to you about the people who are deceiving you.

27.verse: You have received the anointing from him; it abides in you, and you do not need to have anyone teach you. That anointing from him teaches you about everything; it is true, it isn’t a lie. So, just as he taught you, abide in him.

28.verse: And now, children, abide in him, so that when he is revealed we may have boldness and may not be put to shame before him at his royal appearing.

29.verse: If you know that he is righteous, you know that everyone who does what is right has been fathered by him.

1.verse: Born of God - Look at the remarkable love the father has given us – that we should be called God’s children! That indeed is what we are. That’s why the world doesn’t know us, because it didn’t know him.

2.verse: Beloved ones, we are now, already, God’s children; it hasn’t yet been revealed what we are going to be. We know that when he is revealed we shall be like him, because we shall see him as he is.

3.verse: All who have this hope in him make themselves pure, just as he is pure.

4.verse: Everyone who goes on sinning is breaking the law; sin, in fact, is lawlessness.

5.verse: And you know that he was revealed so that he might take away sins, and there is no sin in him.

6.verse: Everyone who abides in him does not go on sinning. Everyone who goes on sinning has not seen him, or known him.

7.verse: Children, don’t let anyone deceive you. The person who does righteousness is righteous, just as he is righteous.

8.verse: The person who goes on sinning is from the devil, because the devil is a sinner from the very start. The son of God was revealed for this purpose, to destroy the works of the devil.

9.verse: Everyone who is fathered by God does not go on sinning, because God’s offspring remain in him; they cannot go on sinning, because they have been fathered by God.

10.verse: That is how it is clear who are the children of God and who are the children of the devil: everyone who does not do what is right is not of God, particularly those who do not love their brother or sister.

11.verse: The Challenge of Love - This is the message which you heard right from the start, you see, that we should love one another.

12.verse: We should not be like Cain, who was of the evil one, and murdered his brother. Why did he murder him? Because his deeds were evil, while his brother’s were right.

13.verse: Don’t be surprised, my brothers and sisters, if the world hates you.

14.verse: We know that we have passed from death to life, because we love the family. Anyone who doesn’t love abides in death.

15.verse: Everyone who hates their brother or sister is a murderer, and you know that no murderer has the life of the coming age abiding in them.

16.verse: This is how we know love: he laid down his life for us. And we too ought to lay down our lives for our brothers and sisters.

17.verse: Anyone who has the means of life in this world, and sees a brother or sister in need, and closes their heart against them – how can God’s love be abiding in them?

18.verse: Children, let us not love in word, or in speech, but in deed and in truth.

19.verse: Because of this, we know we are of the truth, and we will persuade our hearts of this fact before him,

20.verse: because if our hearts condemn us, God is greater than our hearts. He knows everything.

21.verse: Beloved, if our hearts do not condemn us, we have boldness before God,

22.verse: and we receive from him whatever we ask, because we keep his commands and give him pleasure when he sees what we are doing.

23.verse: And this is his command, that we should believe in the name of his son Jesus the Messiah, and should love one another, just as he gave us the commandment.

24.verse: Anyone who keeps his commandments abides in him, and he in them. This is how we know that he abides in us, by his spirit that he has given us.

1.verse: False Prophets - Beloved, do not believe every spirit. Rather, test the spirits to see whether they are from God. Many false prophets, you see, have gone out into the world.

2.verse: This is how we know God’s spirit: every spirit that agrees that Jesus the Messiah has come in the flesh is from God,

3.verse: and every spirit that does not confess Jesus is not from God. This spirit is actually the spirit of the Antimessiah. You have heard that it was coming, and now it is already in the world.

4.verse: But you, children, are from God, and you have overcome them, because the one who is in you is greater than the one who is in the world.

5.verse: They are from the world, and that is why they speak from the world, and why the world listens to them.

6.verse: We are from God; people who know God listen to us, but people who are not from God do not listen to us. That is how we can tell the spirit of truth from the spirit of error.

7.verse: God’s Love - Beloved, let us love one another, because love is from God, and all who love are fathered by God and know God.

8.verse: The one who does not love has not known God, because God is love.

9.verse: This is how God’s love has appeared among us: God sent his only son into the world, so that we should live through him.

10.verse: Love consists in this: not that we loved God, but that he loved us and sent his son to be the sacrifice that would atone for our sins.

11.verse: Beloved, if that’s how God loved us, we ought to love one another in the same way.

12.verse: Nobody has ever seen God. If we love one another, God abides in us and his love is completed in us.

13.verse: That is how we know that we abide in him, and he in us, because he has given us a portion of his spirit.

14.verse: And we have seen and bear witness that the father sent the son to be the world’s saviour.

15.verse: Anyone who confesses that Jesus is God’s son, God abides in them and they abide in God.

16.verse: And we have known and have believed the love which God has for us. God is love; those who abide in love abide in God, and God abides in them.

17.verse: This is what makes love complete for us, so that we may have boldness and confidence on the day of judgment, because just as he is, so are we within this world.

18.verse: There is no fear in love; complete love drives out fear. Fear has to do with punishment, and anyone who is afraid has not been completed in love.

19.verse: We love, because he first loved us.

20.verse: If someone says, ‘I love God’, but hates their brother or sister, that person is a liar. Someone who doesn’t love a brother or sister whom they have seen, how can they love God, whom they haven’t seen?

21.verse: This is the command we have from him: anyone who loves God should love their brother or sister too.

1.verse: Faith Wins the Victory - Everyone who believes that the Messiah is Jesus has been fathered by God. Everyone who loves the parent loves the child as well.

2.verse: That is how we know that we love the children of God, because we love God and do what he commands.

3.verse: This is what loving God means: it means keeping his commandments. His commandments, what’s more, are no trouble,

4.verse: because everything that is fathered by God conquers the world. This is the victory that conquers the world: our faith.

5.verse: Who is the one who conquers the world? Surely the one who believes that Jesus is God’s son!

6.verse: It was he who came by means of water and blood, Jesus the Messiah, not by water only but by the water and the blood. The spirit is the one who bears witness, because the spirit is the truth.

7.verse: There are three that bear witness, you see,

8.verse: the spirit, the water and the blood, and these three agree together.

9.verse: If we have received human witness, God’s witness is greater. This is the witness of God, the testimony he has borne to his son.

10.verse: All those who believe in the son of God have the witness in themselves, but anyone who does not believe in God has made a liar of him, because they have not believed in the witness which God bore concerning his son.

11.verse: This is the witness: God has given us the life of the age to come, and this life is in his son.

12.verse: Anyone who has the son has life. Anyone who does not have the son of God does not have life.

13.verse: The True God - I am writing these things to you so that you may know that you, who believe in the name of the son of God, do indeed have the life of the age to come.

14.verse: This is the bold confidence we have before him: if we ask for something according to his will, he hears us.

15.verse: And if we know that he hears us in whatever we ask, we know that we already possess the requests we have asked from him.

16.verse: If anyone sees a brother or sister committing a sin which is not deadly, they should ask, and God will give life to the people who are sinning in a way which is not deadly. There is such a thing as deadly sin; I do not say that one should pray about that.

17.verse: All sin is unrighteousness, and there is a sin which is not deadly.

18.verse: We know that everyone fathered by God does not go on sinning. The one who was fathered by God keeps them, and the evil one does not touch them.

19.verse: We know that we are from God, and the whole world is under the power of the evil one.

20.verse: We know that the son of God has come and has given us understanding so that we should know the truth. And we are in the truth, in his son Jesus the Messiah. This is the true God; this is the life of the age to come.
